comment: I loved this professor and class SO MUCH! She was great and made the class fun. I recommend her 100%

I had a situaton arise where my classes were dropped and she still counted those assignments towards my grade when i had to come up with the money to pay to get back in. She isnt very understanding and definitely a harsh grader, most proffesors would help you work to pass and she is not one of them.

She is by far the worst psychology professor I have taken at KSU. Some of the quizzes contain material that isn't even covered in the assigned readings. The tests are super difficult for no reason. She tries to come off as "understanding" but she really does not want you to pass the class. I would NOT recommend her at ALL.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: this was such a difficult course. she tests so hard, and there was an insane amount of work for the psych of gender class. i was stressed out and have taken a class with her before which also wasnt amazing but wanted to give her another chance bc it was the only open prof. take someone else if you can. she makes this class extra hard for no reason.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: I loved Dr. Willard's online Gender class - she puts so much effort into providing feedback on quizzes, tests, and the short writing assignments -- I've never seen a professor teach an online course in such a hands-on approach, and I love it! Lots of reading (you won't pass without the book), some writing, and weekly quizzes. Take her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took her for a four-week summer semester class. She changed it to a new book and you could tell that she hadn't quite tailored the content for the course just yet, but even still the information was relatively easy to learn for the exams. I wouldn't say the course content was fun unless you have an interest in the stuff previously.

She makes the class extremely difficult and not fun. She compares the grades we receive in quizzes/exams with students from previous semesters. If you really want to pass this course avoid taking her and go with another professor. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED. AVOID AT ALL COSTS..
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: AVOID HER!! I am a straight A student and hardworking... the highest test grade I got out of 5 tests was one low B. She doesn't care about your grade, she makes fun of kids in class then will blame behavior on the students. If you ask for advice she will just tell you you're "studying wrong". Also, if you end up with an 89.999 she won't round up.

please ignore all the good reviews on her. shes so mean and cruel. she might seem nice but she doesnt WANT you to pass. she wont round grades up even if its less than 1 point. im disgusted and disappointed. not to mention she did laugh at a student blowing her nose in class when that student was obviously socially awkward. terrible psych prof.

she's terrible. makes her class SO hard, and she just doesn't care. she laughed at a student who was OBVIOUSLY socially abnormal and wasn't from here just because she blew her nose in class, and a PSYCHOLOGY professor, that's really disappointing. she doesn't round grades, and she barely gives extra credit or opportunities to raise your grade.

her class is definitely too hard for an INTRO level class. she gives clear instructions for how we should study, but i've done EVERYTHING, and i still haven't gotten not one A on any test (3/5 tests in). she does not listen and adjust after getting feedback. even the TAs think her tests are hard. she just doesn't care. want an A? unlikely with her
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Still in her class currently! She is amazing!! Her lectures are well organized and engaging. She is easy to reach out to and connected me to two forensics majors and other people who helped me pick my major. She is very kind and does a lot of demonstrations to help you understand. You have to work hard & study for the tests but its a great class.

She is amazing. Course is hard but she helps & teaches what u need to know. Each mod has extra worksheets/help. Quizzes weekly w/notes. Tests hard (multi choice, essay, hand calcs) ask for examples of essay questions & take time to answer & u will be good. 1 semester long project that requires lots of research. always willing to answer ?s TAKE HER

Dr Willard is a good professor. Her quizzes are kinda hard. You get two attempts on the quizzes. If you do well on your first attempt good. If you dont do well and you try the second attempt, your first score and second score average out. She is a tough grader. If you need help she will set up time . You will get lots of assignments. .
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This class is hard, no doubt about it but I can really say Dr. Willard is a true gem! She is the sweetest, caring teacher. Yes this hair will make you pull your hair out but this professor really made it easy for me to understand. Just engage her. She is very responsive. She will invest time with you. I will take any class she teaches anyday.

She was really nice as a person and I respect her. The exams were much harder and absolutely nothing like any of the coursework or quizzes. Having only a few graded materials that were difficult made it hard to get my grade up and I absolutely did not expect to make a mad grade in what felt like an easy class.

Run now. Especially online students. Taught different than test. Class avg always was low 60-72% on almost everything. I strongly urge you to find a teacher with great reviews. Very nice lady but her grading is critical as if you are suppose to absolutely know how to do everything perfectly like a professional. I strongly advise no go
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Dr. Willard is a nice person and very friendly. However, the lectures were mundane and exams were nothing like the material we used to study for the exams. I repeat her, but I would not take her again. Social psych felt more difficult than it should have been and I somehow worked hard for a C??

Dr. Willard is a cool lady. She knows what she's talking about and makes social psych really interesting. She gives you chances to earn extra credit and gives enough grades that you aren't just SOL if you do poorly on a test. She was trying an online textbook w/ our class and v sympathetic to student issues with it. I would recommend her overall.
She's great. And cute

I took Dr. Willard during the summer semester and she was a "nice professor " but she gave too much work in a small amount of time. 4 reflection papers, an extra book to read besides the text, group project,4 test and discussion post. She doesn't give a lot of feed back either; be ready to read !!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--TEST HEAVY

comment: You will learn a lot! She tries very hard to be a great professor and it shows. she constantly is looking for feedback for ways to teach her class better. 12 online quizzes ( 2 are dropped), 3 tests, 4 summaries, a large paper and an option final (drops your lowest test grade) Her class is effort intensive but you use everything you learn, take!

Class has very little in class instruction, a frustrating group project component, and WAY too much discussion. She was nice in class, but definitely not a "cool" professor. Ended up majorly screwing me over by waiting over a month to grade a major paper.  She is by far one of the most frustrating professors I have had.  I am NOT a C student.

She hasgood intentions but honestly she was the most difficult teacher I have ever had. If you are a visual learner do not take her, she moves through her lectures really fast and hates going back. Tests are really hard so make sure you start studying on day 1! Make sure you start the research project early.

Professor Willard was an amazing psych teacher. She knows so much on the material and gives good ways of how to remember material. I took her maymester course and she always answered any questions I had about material. Make sure to take notes as there are many terms. You need to be able to give examples and apply terms to situational context.

Final grades are based on a point system which is clearly laid out in the syllabus. Tests are multiple choice. Attendance is mandatory and she does include examples discussed in class on exams.  Decent amount of reading. Would take her again.

I have taken Dr. Willard for two classes at Kennesaw and I loved her! I took her for Research Methods and received an A. Her test are long but the material in this class has to be covered somehow. I made an 87, 85 and a 97 on her exams. Study and read the book and you will be fine. Not a hard class, just treat it like an upper level class.

The class is not an easy course. It is hard and psychology majors know that. You need to come to class, take notes, read the chapters. If you do that you should pass. She does make her self available. The class is just too long and boring thats why people hate it. Overall she was okay, you drop two lowest quiz grades and one lowest test grade.

Professor Willard is an overall good person but the lectures are very boring and dry. The class is difficult test are hard quizzes every week and i forgot to mention she gives worksheets throughout the semester that aren't for a grade

Professor Willard is by far the most helpful professor I have ever had at KSU. She continually blows me away with her class format- there are TONS of opportunities for her students to gain insight and experience into research methods and stats. She literally has mock studies she'll do with us to further understanding. Absolutely phenomenal!
She was just meh. Boring lectures, not really energetic or enthusiastic. Just kind of robotic and professional. The subject was good, but she was just dull.

I took her for 1101 and would not take again. She treats this class like a upper level class. I'm making an A in psych 3305 currently but barely passed with a C in this one, and will probably have to retake it. Super hard tests. She is a helpful teacher, I just wish she didn't make the tests so confusing and include so much material.

Willard is a great, funny professor that makes learning psych fun. Tons of info though. You have to read the textbook AND her powerpoints for the tests or you will fail! As long as you study, you'll pass easily. She had study groups before tests that helped alot.

She is a great teacher. She goes through her power points quickly and can be confusing, but weekly quizzes help her to see what she needs to go back over. She has practice tests that are very helpful. The book is extremely helpful. Attendance is strict. She is good at preparing students for her tests. If u study minimal and go 2 class you'll pass.

Great teacher but would not take again. Too much material on tests. I'm a good student and made detailed study guides for every test but I'm barely passing. I would rejoice if she put less material on each test. Instead we have 4 super long tests that cover everything. I should have dropped it because I'm struggling to pass right now.

Love Dr. Willard! I was freaking out prior to this class because I am not a good test taker. Lots of work outside of class. Take notes during lecture. LISTEN!! She knows the material is dry and does a good job making it interesting. Read and do study guide and you should do well on tests! Just glad I passed!!

She is a very nice professor, but very difficult. The material and study guides are overwhelming, and she expects you to know it all. Her powerpoints are long and she has a book club, which is done in groups. Would not take her again nor recommend her!
Take her! She's awesome and makes the class seem so easy and interesting. Her tests are half multiple choice and half short answer, but directly from slides/notes. Just take her!

I recommend this teacher. She really wants the class to learn and understand the material. She offers her help constantly. The class isn't an easy course but she definitely teaches it well. Go to class every time and go to the SI sessions if offered.

I took honors psych 101 with Dr. Willard and she was awesome. I really enjoyed coming to class. Dr. Willard is a difficult professor though, and rightfully so. General Psychology is a very broad subject, so it was a ton of material. You have to read all the modules if you want a good grade. If you don't like psych definitely do not take this class.

Class was alright. Dr. Willard didn't really do anything wrong but our TA, Justin, was what saved my grade! We had 5 exams and she drops the lowest. Then we had 12 ONLINE quizzes & she drops the lowest 2. Book club was alright, pick Mindless Eating or Bonk! If you really dedicated the time, you could get an A but it is hard!

Dr. Willard is awesome. Research Methods is a pretty hard class, but she is really helpful if you make an appointment with her or ask a question in class. She is a little bit unorganized and scatter brained, but overall she is a cool teacher. I recommend!

Hard class but, very helpful. She grades very hard on the Literature Review paper and it is based upon a process that is learned over the course of the semester. Fail early in the literature review study because you will not have the understanding or skills to write it until the latter half of the semester - and by then it's too late.

Dr. Willard is tough and challenging yet very helpful and caring.  Though the workload seemed overwhelming it all did help.  She has you do multiple assignments that will prepare you for your final paper and that totally helped!  Definitely go to class, read the book, ask questions.  She always will help!  She is very nice and great personality!
She's pretty hard but a great prof

She is a really hard teacher who teaches at a graduate level. She gives a section outline and a study guide for each test, but the study guide has so much information on it that it is overwhelming. She uses powerpoints.

She is always enthusiastic about the material that is taught. With this energy she influences everybody in class, and raises more interests. If she doesn't know something, she will find the answer and bring it to class. Also, she answers every question in a fair and professional way, and lets students speak up and is interested in their opinion.

She is a great professor, very smart and helpful. Research methods is the hardest class I have ever taken but she is very clear. Class is long and boring though but it's not her fault. She is fair and lets you know what she expects. I am definitely going to try to take her again for social psych or psych of gender, great professor.

Dr. Willard is amazing! RM is a challenging course, yet the way she presented the material in class made it easy to understand and also enjoyable! She did many in-class activities to help engage students in their learning, and before moving on, she always asked if there were questions. If you don√¢??t understand something (in lecture or book), ASK!

Dr. Willard is a great teacher and very willing to help.  She doesn't require attendance but to do well you need to go to class and read the book.  The class itself is hard no matter who you take for the class.  I would definitely recommend her for any class.

The class is very difficult and the material is not interesting. Only taking it because it is a required class. Her tests are very hard and required to know SO much information. She provides a "study guide" but it is very broad. Research paper is a semester long and requires APA.

RM is a very difficult class. The material is very dry, but she does a great job of making the class fun and interactive. Most of the material comes from the book, and the notes are not very helpful. Her tests and assignments are brutal, but if you put effort into the class you will do well.

The professor is nice and the class was interesting but there was so much information to memorize.  The information is massive and that makes the class hard.  Her class average is a "C" and she will let you know on day 1 so not easy A is this class...we had to do a group project on narcissism...be ready for a lot reading & studying

I would definitely recommend Dr. Willard. RM is a challenging course and she is very helpful and available to students. Her class is challenging, and you have to pay attention in class and study hard for exams to pass. The research proposal is the most challenging part of the class. Still, it was a great experience and I would take her again.

The average grade in her class is a C, which she says is consistent with previous semesters. However, knowing this, she doesn't change her style of teaching, her tests, etc. She teaches a lower division requirement like it is an upper division course. She expects a graduate knowledge for an undergraduate course. I highly discourage taking her.

I would highly suggest Dr. willard! I took her for research methods and social psychology. No, she is not extremely easy, but she is also not that difficult. If you read, try to get the concepts, and go to class you'll get a good grade. She is also extremely helpful, she wants you to do well!

Dr. Willard is very knowledgeable about her field. She gives about 6 hard quizzes, 2 assignments and 4 tests. If you want to do good in the class, you must read the text book. Tests are taken directly from the book. She takes attendance every day and gives participation points periodically. She gives power points in class that aren't that helpful.
Awful teacher. Powerpoints are very simple and broad, while texts are extremly specific and HARD!!!!!!
Blah! She's horrible. She's the reason why I changed my major!

Awesome prof. Very informative, posts ppts, and study guides gives great lectures. Doesn't require attendance and is very willing to work with her students, offers extra credit. Does grades on a pt system around 750 of them total. 4 exams, 1 project, 1 long butt paper

She is so sweet! If you go to class you will succeed. I never went to class and got a C. Just tests, random attendance days, and 3 creative writing assignments. Uses interesting and entertaining examples to help understand material. Great class!
She is tough but fair. You you will come out of her class with a great understanding of the material, if your willing to put the work in. I will take her again.

Dr. Willard is so nice and really goes out of her way to help her students. Attendance isnt mandatory, but she does do participation points, so you will miss those if you don't go to class. There is also a lot of work associated with this class so be prepared!Tests are tricky, about half multiple choice, half short answer.Read the book AND lecture!

She is very nice and helpful. She realy makes the class interesting by doing different things.  This professor deperately wants you to understand that social psychology is not a joke and not a breeze. It seems like she goes out of her way to be difficult. You MUST read ahead of time for the random quizzes, do all the 3 assignments and you'll be ok.

Do not take her.  She new to teaching right out college.  She is a great researcher which is why she was hired, but she lacks any skill in teaching.  She also cry's easy.  If you got a 69.99999% for the class you will fail, she refuses to bump up at all. She is difficult to follow, she may give extra credit i.e., 4 points out of 740, not a big help

Her study guides are just outlines from the book. Her tests are anything but straight from the book. Her slides do not help on the tests either. You must teach yourself. Quizzes are easy but random. Attendance is critical. She is anal at grading papers. She makes the class fun but extremely hard to get an A. I think she secretly hates men.

If you are ready to get your GPA messed up or just want to learn psychology by your self then take her. Besides I would try to stay away from this teacher, but I must add she is a nice lady. Just can't teach doesnt know how to yet its only her 2nd semester teaching.

She is a very good professor, she wants you to understand her lectures and to get something from her class. Her class is not easy, you have to put in some work, if you work hard, you will get a good grade. Read the chapters so you can go along with the lecture and be ready for pop quizzes

She is a GREAT teacher! She wants her students to succeed and if you come to class and participate, she will help you as much as she can. She is very clear about what she expects, and LISTEN when she tells you to read BEFORE class!! You will understand everything SO MUCH BETTER!! She is very flexible and understanding, and offers EASY extra credit!

4 tests, 3 assignments, 8 quizzes, participation mandatory = TOO MUCH! She means well and really enjoys teaching, but she needs to limit the amount of busywork! If you want to work your a** off to make a B then go for it!!!
Good Teacher. made the course clear and easy. stuck to schedule but was willing to shift things. doesnt post slides to Web but class is easy if you attend.

Great! Genuinely very committed to students learning the material & being prepared for experimental. Very approachable & helpful. Keeps you motivated, even when it gets tough. Make sure to start the research proposal early and don't put it off. It is a HUGE project. Also have to do an observational project, 2 presentations, 4 exams, & assignments.

Nice professor. Knows her stuff pretty well. You'll want to read the chapters before class so you can better understand the lecture. 4 tests, 4 writing assignments, 8 quizzes, and participation points. Tests are essay, short answer, and multiple choice. Tests are sometimes tricky, but not impossible. Go to class, read, and you will do fine.
